glozow: i think so
Yeah, currently it's 15:01 UTC, meeting is at 16:00 UTC (according to topic).
Dang daylight savings , I‚Äôll be in transit during meeting. Here‚Äôs the QML update:
Continuing on review and getting what‚Äôs open in the repo merged, before moving on to the next building blocks.
If anyone‚Äôs interested, the following are currently reviewable:
1. https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml/pull/435 (Request payment form)
2. https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml/pull/418 (Add wallet button)
3. https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml/pull/442 (Activity page)

#topic Erlay WG Update (sr_gi, gleb, marcofleon)
hi
hi
Currently working on updating the approach for #30116 based on the simulations results
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30116 | p2p: Fill reconciliation sets (Erlay) attempt 2 by sr-gi ¬∑ Pull Request #30116 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
hi
hi
I'd like to test this on warnet after to see if real node sims match our current results
Hi
And move forward if so
That's all from me
#topic Fuzzing WG Update (dergoegge)
open sources the functional fuzz test prototype: https://github.com/dergoegge/fuzzamoto
hi
thanks to instagibbs for testing it out!
that's it from me
#topic Kernel WG Update (TheCharlatan)
stickies-v left some review r.e. thread safety in the C API header.
There are a few open questions around that, but I like his suggestion of wrapping things where performance matters less in mutexes as an easy fix.
At least putting them in the wrapper/API glue code seems less intrusive than introducing atomics in a bunch of places in our codebase.
Also did some more reading of assumeutxo logic, which might go into a writeup. Still not entirely clear to me how assumeutxo will be exposed in the kernel at this point.
Other than that, looking for review in #31382
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31382 | kernel: Flush in ChainstateManager destructor by TheCharlatan ¬∑ Pull Request #31382 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
That's all :)
there's also the new #bitcoin-kernel channel here on libera for anyone who wants to join the discussion, including users and folks outside the WG
#topic Cluster Mempool WG Update (sdaftuar, sipa)
hi
not much to say about the open PRs, still waiting for more review on the first one (and thanks abubakarsadiq for review of the second one!)
i've also started experimenting with a min-cut based linearizer, based on the papers pointed out in the delving thread, plus a few more and discussions with aj
O(n^3) seems pretty doable to achieve, if my understanding is correct, but too early to say anything about concrete performance
that's it for me
#topic Stratum v2 WG Update (sjors)
#31283 landed
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31283 | Add waitNext() to BlockTemplate interface by Sjors ¬∑ Pull Request #31283 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
Which was the last interface method I need for the Sv2 Template Provider.
Some little things remain on the interface side,
but getting multiprocess in is now the biggest thing.
hi
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31375 | multiprocess: Add bitcoin wrapper executable by ryanofsky ¬∑ Pull Request #31375 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31741 | multiprocess: Add libmultiprocess git subtree by ryanofsky ¬∑ Pull Request #31741 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
That's all from my end.
There's a few things read-ish for merge that might land now that v29 is branched off.
achow101 is not here, but does anybody else have updates on musig2 or legacy wallet removal? furszy?
hey I can share updates on musig2
#topic musig2 update (rkrux)
there are 3 PRs that can be reviewed atm

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31243 | descriptor: Move filling of keys from `DescriptorImpl::MakeScripts` to `PubkeyProvider::GetPubKey` by achow101 ¬∑ Pull Request #31243 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31247 | psbt: MuSig2 Fields by achow101 ¬∑ Pull Request #31247 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31622 | psbt: add non-default sighash types to PSBTs and unify sighash type match checking by achow101 ¬∑ Pull Request #31622 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
the first one I think is closest to being merged once the feedback is addressed, it's a refactor PR
For the legacy wallet removal: Focus is currently on #31961, which seems quite close. And the next PR in line will be #31250.
for the rest 2, I need to re-review that I will get to sometime next week
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31961 | Require sqlite when building the wallet by Sjors ¬∑ Pull Request #31961 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31250 | wallet: Disable creating and loading legacy wallets by achow101 ¬∑ Pull Request #31250 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
that's it from my end
@sjors what's required on the interface side?
abubakarsadiq: #31785
cool. skipping orphan reso, benchmarking, and silent payments. and looks like jarolrod gave the QML update earlier.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31785 | Have createNewBlock() wait for tip, make rpc handle shutdown during long poll and wait methods by Sjors ¬∑ Pull Request #31785 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
^ that just deals with some edge cases startup and shutdown
re silent payments: lots of activity in libsecp256k1 this week, including review of the silent payment PR
thanks üëçüèæ
sipa: ah thanks!
#topic 29 release
branch-off was yesterday and rc1 was tagged last night, please fire up your guix builds.
there is a testing guide being written here: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/29.0-Release-Candidate-Testing-Guide
are any of the FOSS program folks here?
feedback issue for the RC testing guide is at #32026
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/32026 | 29.0 RC Testing Guide Feedback ¬∑ Issue #32026 ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin ¬∑ GitHub
I think that's all then. Anything else to discuss?
#endmeeting
